A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The worst Star Wars movie in the entire franchise. Sadly this is the headline I must give this terrible excuse for a Star Wars movie. I’m a lifelong Star Wars fan but The Last Jedi made me shed tears of indignation because it was so disappointing. Some may be thinking that the prequels were worse\, however the prequels actually had a plot and story that were somewhat coherent. Episodes 1 and 2 were more for children and was meant to be more on the humor side\, in order to give Vader a proper introduction. Nearly every scene in the TLJ had serious flaws\, plot holes\, plot armor\, and continuity issues. The jokes in the movies were completely out of place and drastically took away from the more serious scenes. The worst thing that Rian Johnson did was try and demythologize Star Wars\, which is all about its mythological like Heroes and Villains. Everything that was built up in Episode 7 was completely destroyed and humiliated in TLJ. The best way I can put this is: TLJ doesn’t really build on anything that has been built on from over 40 years of Star Wars.
